item.description:
Film screening and conversation with E. O. Wilson and T. Berry Brazelton (followed by discussion at a local pub; we'll meet outside the front entrance of the Science Center & pick a place).

The life of Edward O. Wilson has inspired a generation to learn about and care for Earth's biodiversity. The HMNH presents a 30-minute preview of his film biography The Naturalist, followed by a conversation with Wilson and Brazelton about encouraging future generations to discover the natural world. Dr. Wilson is the Pellegrino Professor Emeritus at Harvard's Museum of Comparative Zoology. Dr. Brazelton is Clinical Professor of Pediatrics, Emeritus, at Harvard.

Link

This event is free and open to the public.
S.

~ ~ ~
item.name: Raising Tomorrow's Naturalists (E.O. Wilson)
